The policymakers believe that this currency could greatly benefit the Lone Star State and, as an alternative digital currency, it could provide Texas residents with the ability to circumvent a central bank digital currency (CBDC).

NFT Sales Improve This Week, Rising 7.28% Higher
Sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have trended higher this week, increasing by 7.28%, with $179.64 million in sales recorded over the past seven days. Of the total sales, $111.62 million, or 62.35%, came from NFT sales on the Ethereum blockchain, cryptoslam.io stats show. Solanaâ€™s NFT sales were the second-largest this week, accounting for $20.66 million, or 11.54%, of the weekâ€™s total sales.

entry.summary:
Polygon, Ethereumâ€™s layer-2 scaling solution, is swiftly emerging asÂ a powerhouseÂ in the gaming industry, thanks to a rise in user activity on its network.
Polygon had a 53% growth in daily unique active wallets (dUAWs) last month, reaching 138,081 in March, making it the second-largest blockchain gaming network in terms of UAWs, according to DappRadar.
Polygonâ€™s expansion in the game business is important, given the company was originally recognized for its DeFi dApps. In March, the network surpassed Hive to take second place, a positive indication for Polygon as it develops and recognized as a gaming blockchain.

entry.title: Biggest Movers:Â ADA Extends Gains, as SOL Consolidates on Saturday
entry.summary:
Cardano rose for a second straight session to start the weekend, as the token continued to move away from a key price floor. Cryptocurrency markets were marginally higher in todayâ€™s session, with the global market up 0.56% as of writing. Solana continued to consolidate on Saturday.
Cardano (ADA)
Cardano (ADA) rose for a second consecutive session, as the token moved away from a recent support point.
Following a low of $0.3783 on Friday, ADA/USD jumped to an intraday peak at $0.3902 to start the weekend.
As a result of the move, cardano moved further away from a recent floor at $0.3775, following a failed breakout attempt.
From the chart, it appears that bulls rejected the breakout after the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) bounced from a floor at 55.00.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 56.96, with a ceiling at 60.00 a potential target for traders.
Should they reach this destination, there is a good chance that ADA will be trading above $0.4000.
Solana (SOL)
After a volatile week of trading, solana (SOL) entered the weekend marginally higher, however price uncertainty was also high.
SOL/USD reached a top at $20.71 to start the weekend, a day after sitting at a low of $20.33.
Saturdayâ€™s activity sees solana continue to hover close to a long-term floor at $20.15, and this comes following a crossover of moving averages (MA).
The 10-day (red) MA moved below its 25-day (blue) counterpart earlier in the week, however was unable to extend its distance from this trendline.
This comes as the 14-day RSI remains close to a point of support of its own, at the 46.00 mark.
Until a breakout of this floor occurs, or there is a move above resistance, it is likely that SOL will continue to trend sideways.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect solana to rally this weekend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Back Above $28,000 on Easter Weekend
entry.summary:
Bitcoin was back above $28,000 on Saturday, as markets continued to react to the latest nonfarm payrolls (NFP) report. Figures released on Friday showed that 236,000 jobs were added to the U.S. economy last month. Ethereum was also back in the green to start the weekend.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) surged back above the $28,000 level on Saturday, as markets continued to react to the latest NFP report.
Payrolls came in at 236,000, which was marginally lower than the 240,000 sum many were anticipating.
BTC/USD rose to an intraday high of $28,159.86 earlier in todayâ€™s session, less than 24 hours after trading at a low of $27,824.15.
Looking at the chart, it appears that the increase in price comes as the relative strength index (RSI) bounced from its floor at 58.00
As of writing, the index is tracking at 59.07, which has helped delay an inevitable downwards cross with the 10-day (red) moving average and its 25-day (blue) counterpart.
BTC is trading at $28,024.28 at the time of writing.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) started todayâ€™s session in the green, as prices attempted to move back towards the $1,900 level.
Following a low of $1,845.99 on Friday, ETH/USD climbed to a peak of $1,879.11 to start the weekend.
The move saw the worldâ€™s second largest cryptocurrency snap a two-day losing streak, after staying above a floor at $1,830.
Despite the slight increase in price, ethereumâ€™s price strength remains below a key support point at 61.00.
As of writing, the 14-day RSI is tracking at 60.42, and should a breakout occur, there will be a greater chance of price moving above $1,900.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will ethereum continue to consolidate this weekend? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.summary: Despite flagging demand for Alexa, experts say Amazon could still pull ahead of the pack.

entry.title: â€˜Bitcoin Stampsâ€™ NFTs Are Gaining On Ordinals
entry.summary: The creator of the new protocol claims it is the â€œmost permanentâ€ means of inscribing data on the Bitcoin blockchain.

entry.title: AI Fears Grow as Germany, France, Sweden, and Canada Voice Concerns
entry.summary: In the wake of an outright ban of ChatGPT in Italy, governments are trying to balance innovation with protecting user privacy.

entry.title: Is Texas Still 'Very Open for Business' for Bitcoin Mining?
entry.summary: The state is a mining hot-spot, but a new bill limiting benefits got unanimous approval by a state Senate committee. Mining advocates are concerned.

entry.title: Future of Paxful Bitcoin Exchange in Flux As Co-Founders Fight
entry.summary: One wants to resume operation of the marketplace, the other is directing users to an alternative service.

entry.title: MobileCoin Exec Bob Lee Fatally Stabbed in San Francisco
entry.summary: The Cash App creator also led Google's Android team and helped combat the COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: Meta Reveals AI Tool to Help Brands Target Facebook, Instagram Users
entry.summary: Metaâ€™s recent embrace of AI is only growing, with new plans for generative adsâ€”and Metaâ€™s CTO thinks AI will help power the metaverse, too.

entry.title: MicroStrategy Buys More Bitcoin as Asset Nears Companyâ€™s Break Even Price
entry.summary: The software company is still buying up the cryptocurrencyâ€”which has soared in value since January.

entry.title: 'Lollipop' NFT Racing Game From Filmmaker David Ayer Coming to Polygon
entry.summary: Feature.io tapped â€œThe Fast and Furiousâ€ co-writer Ayer to write and produce the project, which is billed as an interactive media experience.

entry.title: 'District 9' Director Is Launching a Web3 Gameâ€”With a Dedicated Avalanche Subnet
entry.summary: Developer Gunzilla Games and Neill Blomkamp will roll out the upcoming battle royale shooter via an Avalanche subnet.

entry.title: Batteries or Bitcoin: Is Mining the Best Use for â€˜Excessâ€™ Green Energy?
entry.summary: Bitcoin miners are quick to claim they're an asset to grids, while others suggest itâ€™s not the best use of excess green energy. Which is it?

entry.title: CoinFLEX Founder Offers Bitcoin Evangelist Roger Ver â€˜Olive Branchâ€™ to Settle Alleged $84M Debt
entry.summary: The CoinFLEX founder offered Ver and Blockchain.comâ€™s CEO two years of free trading on OPNX should they settle their debts.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFiâ€”ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isnâ€™t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decryptâ€™s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and whyâ€”despite his growing profileâ€”he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Societyâ€™s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decryptâ€™s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Brosâ€™ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
